meanings.definition: To force or squeeze something into a space that is too small
meanings.sent1: He was shoehorning his feet into the tiny shoes.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was shoehorning the last piece of wood into the tight corner.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried shoehorning the large cake into the small oven, but it was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was shoehorning her thoughts into the brief conversation.
meanings.sent5: The students were shoehorning their backpacks into the already full locker, causing a commotion.

meanings.definition: The act of fitting something into a space that is too small
meanings.sent1: The shoehorning of the bookshelf into the narrow hallway was a challenge.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the shoehorning of the oversized package into the mailbox.
meanings.sent3: The shoehorning of the large family into the tiny car was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The shoehorning of the extra chair into the crowded room was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The shoehorning of the jigsaw puzzle pieces into the small box was a test of patience.
